revised_title: A Comprehensive Study on Boundary Lubrication and its Mechanism
tldr: This article discusses the mechanism of boundary lubrication, focusing on the interaction between sliding surfaces and the role of boundary films in reducing friction. The author explains the importance of chemical reactions between lubricants and metal surfaces, as well as the effect of temperature on the lubrication process. The article also highlights the differences between physically adsorbed and chemically formed layers, and the methods used to study surface damage and metal transference during sliding.
